newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Woolworths says can maintain sales.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Woolworths says can maintain sales.

text.p: Retailer Woolworths Ltd said on Monday it was confident it could maintain current sales and profit growth for the remainder of the 1996/97 financial year.
It also said it saw no return to double digit sales growth in the current low inflation environment.
"We are confident we can maintain current sales predictions and profit growth for the remainder of this financial year," managing director Reg Clairs told reporters.
"With underlying inflation running at 1.5 percent I don't see any return to double digit growth in the foreseeable future," he added.
Clairs said he would be happy if Woolworths achieved sales growth of 8.5 percent over the next 12 months.
